arguments.summary: Exactly two input .sam or .bam files to compare to one another.
arguments.name: [NA - Positional]
arguments.fulltext: Exactly two input .sam or .bam files to compare to one another.

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: Perform lenient checking of duplicate marks.  In this mode, will reduce the number of mismatches by allowing the choice of the representative read in each duplicate set to differ between the input files, as long as the duplicate sets agree.
arguments.name: --LENIENT_DUP

arguments.summary: Perform lenient checking of header.  In this mode, species, assembly, ur, m5, fields of sequence records, and pg fields in the header may all differ. Sequence record length must also be the same.
arguments.name: --LENIENT_HEADER

arguments.summary: Count reads which have mapping quality below LOW_MQ_THRESHOLD in both files but are mapped to different locations as matches.  By default we count such reads as mismatching.
arguments.name: --LENIENT_LOW_MQ_ALIGNMENT

arguments.summary: Count reads for which no mapping quality is available (mapping quality value 255) in both files but are mapped to different locations as matches.  By default we count such reads as mismatching.
arguments.name: --LENIENT_UNKNOWN_MQ_ALIGNMENT

arguments.summary: When running in LENIENT_LOW_MQ_ALIGNMENT mode, reads which have mapping quality below this value will be counted as matches. if LENIENT_LOW_MQ_ALIGNMENT is false (default), then this argument has no effect.
arguments.name: --LOW_MQ_THRESHOLD

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: Output file to write comparison results to.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

description:
Rudimentary SAM comparer.  Compares headers, and if headers are compatible enough, compares SAMRecords,
 looking only at basic alignment info.  Summarizes the number of alignments that match, mismatch, are missing, etc.
name: CompareSAMs
